links.title: Top-Ranked Stocks That Crushed S&P 500 in Longest Bull Run
links.description: The U.S. bull market has now become the longest on record since World War II by avoiding a drop of 20% or more (the traditional definition of a bear market). Its run of 3,453 days or nine and-a-half years outpaced the 3,452-day record set during Sep 11, 1990 to Mar 24, 2000.

Nvidia Is Competing With Its Best Customers http://bit.ly/2NcMWF5 $NVDA $AMZN $MSFT $AAPL $GOOGL $FB

links.title: Nvidia Is Competing With Its Best Customers
links.description: The rise of Nvidia (NASDAQ:) has been driven, not by bitcoin, but by its data-center business. As the Cloud Czars - Amazon.com (NASDAQ:), Microsoft (NASDAQ:), Apple (NASDAQ:), Alphabet (NASDAQ:, NASDAQ:) and Facebook (NASDAQ:) - race to add artificial intelligence to their clouds to support next-generation services, they're buying fast graphics chips from Nvidia in car-load lots.

links.title: Battle of Dividends: Apple vs Microsoft
links.description: In a head-to-head comparison earlier this year, (( Apple NASDAQ:AAPL) came out ahead of Microsoft NASDAQ:MSFT) as a better dividend stock. But since that comparison in March, shares of Apple have significantly outperformed Microsoft. Could Apple's steep gain in its stock price alter the outcome of a face-off between these two dividend-paying stocks today?

links.title: Stocks making the biggest move premarket: BABA, HRL, PLCE, DECK, WSM & more
links.description: Alibaba - The China-based e-commerce giant reported adjusted earnings of 8.04 yuan per share, below the consensus estimate of 8.15. However, revenue was above forecasts and jumped 61 percent from a year earlier. Alibaba also saw a jump of 17 million mobile monthly average users from the prior quarter, to a total of 634 million.
